          Projects the objects in the given iterable by converting each of them in a set of key/value pairs.

Uses of Converter in ch.lambdaj.function.convert
 

Subinterfaces of Converter in ch.lambdaj.function.convert
 interface StringConverter<F>
          Specifies how to convert from an object of type F to a String
 

Classes in ch.lambdaj.function.convert that implement Converter
 class AliasedArgumentConverter<F,T>
          Converts an object in a key/value pair where the value is the one returned by the evaluation of the given argument on the object itself.
 class ArgumentConverter<F,T>
          Converts an object in the value returned by the evaluation of the given argument on it.
 class ConstructorArgumentConverter<F,T>
          Creates an object of the given Class by invoking its constructor passing to it the values taken from the object to be converted using the given arguments.
 class DefaultStringConverter
          Converts an object in its String representation or an empty String for a null object.
 class ProjectConverter<F>
          Convert an Object in map of key/value pairs by projecting them using the given projectors
 class PropertyExtractor<F,T>
          Converts an Object in the value it has on the name property.
 class StringLengthConverter
          Converts a String in an Integer equal to its length.
 class StringPropertyExtractor<T>
          Converts an Object in the String representation of the value it has on the name property.
 

Constructors in ch.lambdaj.function.convert with parameters of type Converter
ConverterIterator(Converter<F,T> converter, java.util.Iterator<F> iterator)
          Creates a ConverterIterator
ProjectConverter(Converter<F,java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>>... projectors)
          Creates a Converter that converts an Object in map of key/value pairs by projecting them using the given projectors
